title: Farmers' Guide to High-quality Seed Production

tasks.task: Drive the forklift to transport farm supplies.
subtasks: Operate the steering wheel to navigate the forklift.
Engage the forklift's hydraulic system to lift the supplies.
Use hand controls to adjust the forklift's lift height.
Drive the forklift to the designated storage area.
Align the forklift with the storage position.
Lower the supplies onto the storage rack or pallet.

tasks.task: Unload the forklift by transferring supplies to storage.
subtasks: Disengage the lift and tilt the forks to lower the supplies.
Walk the forklift to the appropriate storage location.
Insert the forks into the storage rack or stacking area.
Release the load and lift the fork slightly.
Drive the forklift away from the storage area.

tasks.task: Securely store farm supplies to prevent damage.
subtasks: Organize supplies on the storage rack or pallet.
Ensure all stacks are stable and won't topple.
Lock away or cover valuable or perishable items.

tasks.task: Perform pre-shift safety checks on the forklift.
subtasks: Inspect the forklift tires for wear or damage.
Check the hydraulic fluid levels and condition.
Test the lift and tilt functions to ensure operation.
Verify the brakes are functioning properly.
Check that safety features (like seatbelts) are intact.

tasks.task: Prepare the farm truck for returning to work.
subtasks: Secure any loose items in the truck bed.
Ensure farm equipment is properly attached or stored.
Check fuel levels and add if necessary.
Inspect the truck's lights and horn for functionality.

tasks.task: Operate the truck to transport farm supplies.
subtasks: Start the truck engine and check the dashboard gauges.
Signal other vehicles at intersections during drive.
Maintain proper speed limit and safe distance from other vehicles.
Navigate dirt roads or farm tracks without damaging them.
Stop at designated areas to pick up or drop off supplies.
Park the truck safely in the designated area or shed.

tasks.task: Load the farm truck with necessary materials.
subtasks: Open the truck bed or doors to access the loading area.
Position the forklift forks under the load to be moved.
Secure the load on the truck bed, ensuring it won't shift.
Check tie-downs or straps are tight and secure.

tasks.task: Assist in manual stacking of supplies when necessary.
subtasks: Carry supplies from the forklift to the stack area.
Lift and place items on a higher stack, using box or hay as previous.
Make sure stacks are stable and balanced to prevent collapse.

tasks.task: Ensure proper ventilation for stored grain or produce.
subtasks: Adjust the ventilation fans in the storage area.
Open windows or doors if necessary for natural airflow.
Check for any blockages in vents or air channels.

tasks.task: Check for potential rodent entry points in storage areas.
subtasks: Inspect the storage perimeter for gaps or holes.
Seal entry points with caulk or mesh if any are found.
Set up traps or deterrents if rodents are present.

tasks.task: Inspect storage area for temperature and moisture levels.
subtasks: Use a thermometer to check the temperature of stored goods.
Check for dampness or standing water in the storage area.
Open storage rooms or areas to improve air circulation.

tasks.task: Communicate with other farmworkers for coordination.
subtasks: Use two-way radios or walkie-talkies to coordinate tasks.
Brief team members on the day's work priorities.
Check for safety equipment needs or personal protective equipment.

tasks.task: Conduct regular walk-throughs of the farm premises.
subtasks: Check for hazards such as downed power lines or unsafe structures.
Look for signs of crop damage or pest infestations.
Report any issues to the appropriate supervisor or manager.

tasks.task: Handle the loading and unloading of equipment trucks.
subtasks: Assist in moving farm equipment from the truck to the storage area.
Connect or disconnect trailers or attachments as needed.
Ensure all equipment is properly placed in its designated spot.

tasks.task: Ensure access to clean water for cooling or irrigation.
subtasks: Check water tank levels and refill as necessary.
Inspect water distribution systems for leaks or clogs.
Turn on sprinklers or irrigation systems for necessary watering.
